column4: is there a way to configure wireless interfaces in Ubuntu, like in Windows-- point and click a task tray icon?

I can just use ifconfig but :/ It's hard to pitch Linux when it's like "you have to do some ass like go into Admin->stuff->system->networking click the interface add your IP and do stuff. . ." rather than "Click the Wireless Networks applet here and it'll list all your wireless cards and let you plug into any network they find"
